PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mrs. Olive E. Highgate, 413 Grove Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 28, 1957, pg.3 with question: "Do you think Pennsylvania's 'blue laws' against 'unnecessary' Sunday sales should be enforced?" answer reads: "Yes, I think that the state should. We've every day in the week to shop and Sunday should be one day that we hold sacred.  We have six days and the seventh day should be for worship."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Olive E. Highgate, wearing dark hat and coat with three buttons, holding paper bag, standing in front of light colored marble wall between store windows with lamp displays
